lines.line_text: WHILE new-ca'd kye rowte at the stake,
An' pownies reek in pleugh or braik,
This hour on e'enin's edge I take,
To own I'm debtor,
To honest-hearted, auld L*****K,
For his kind letter.

stanzas.stanza_text:
WHILE new-ca'd kye rowte at the stake,
An' pownies reek in pleugh or braik,
This hour on e'enin's edge I take,
To own I'm debtor,
To honest-hearted, auld L*****K,
For his kind letter.

lines.line_text: Forjesket sair, with weary legs,
Rattlin the corn out-owre the rigs,
Or dealing thro' amang the naigs
Their ten-hours bite,
My awkart Muse sair pleads and begs,
I would na write.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Forjesket sair, with weary legs,
Rattlin the corn out-owre the rigs,
Or dealing thro' amang the naigs
Their ten-hours bite,
My awkart Muse sair pleads and begs,
I would na write.

lines.line_text: The tapetless, ramfeezl'd hizzie,
She's saft at best an' something lazy,
Quo' she, 'Ye ken we've been sae busy
'This month an' mair,
' That trouth, my head is grown right dizzie,
'An' something fair.'

stanzas.stanza_text:
The tapetless, ramfeezl'd hizzie,
She's saft at best an' something lazy,
Quo' she, 'Ye ken we've been sae busy
'This month an' mair,
' That trouth, my head is grown right dizzie,
'An' something fair.'

lines.line_text: Her dowf excuses pat me mad;
'Conscience,' says I, 'ye thowless jad!
' I'll write, an' that a hearty blaud,
'This vera night;
' So dinna ye affront your trade,
'But rhyme it right.
'Shall bauld L*****K, the king o' hearts,
' Tho' mankind were a pack o' cartes,
'Roose you sae weel for your deserts,
' In terms sae friendly,
'Yet ye'll neglect to shaw your parts
' An' thank him kindly? '

stanzas.stanza_text:
'Shall bauld L*****K, the king o' hearts,
' Tho' mankind were a pack o' cartes,
'Roose you sae weel for your deserts,
' In terms sae friendly,
'Yet ye'll neglect to shaw your parts
' An' thank him kindly? '

lines.line_text: Sae I gat paper in a blink,
An, down gaed stumpie in the ink:
Quoth I, 'Before I sleep a wink,
' I vow I'll close it;
'An' if ye winna mak it clink,
' By Jove I'll prose it! '

stanzas.stanza_text:
Sae I gat paper in a blink,
An, down gaed stumpie in the ink:
Quoth I, 'Before I sleep a wink,
' I vow I'll close it;
'An' if ye winna mak it clink,
' By Jove I'll prose it! '

lines.line_text: Sae I've begun to scrawl, but whether
In rhyme, or prose, or baith thegither,
Or some hotch-potch that's rightly neither,
Let time mak proof;
But I shall scribble down some blether
Just clean aff-loof.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Sae I've begun to scrawl, but whether
In rhyme, or prose, or baith thegither,
Or some hotch-potch that's rightly neither,
Let time mak proof;
But I shall scribble down some blether
Just clean aff-loof.

lines.line_text: My worthy friend, ne'er grudge an' carp,
Tho' Fortune use you hard an' sharp;
Come, kittle up your moorlan harp
Wi' gleesome touch!
Ne'er mind how Fortune waft an' warp;
She's but a b-tch.
She's gien me monie a jirt an' fleg,
Sin I could striddle owre a rig;
But by the L  d, tho' I should beg
Wi' lyart pow,
I'll laugh, an' sing, an' shake my leg,
As lang's I dow!

stanzas.stanza_text:
She's gien me monie a jirt an' fleg,
Sin I could striddle owre a rig;
But by the L  d, tho' I should beg
Wi' lyart pow,
I'll laugh, an' sing, an' shake my leg,
As lang's I dow!

lines.line_text: Now comes the sax an' twentieth simmer,
I've seen the bud upo' the timmer,
Still persecuted by the limmer
Frae year to year;
But yet, despite the kittle kimmer,
I, Rob, am here,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Now comes the sax an' twentieth simmer,
I've seen the bud upo' the timmer,
Still persecuted by the limmer
Frae year to year;
But yet, despite the kittle kimmer,
I, Rob, am here,

lines.line_text: Do ye envy the city-gent,
Behint a kist to lie an' sklent,
Or purse-proud, big wi' cent per cent,
An' muckle wame,
In some bit Brugh to represent
A Baillie's name?

stanzas.stanza_text:
Do ye envy the city-gent,
Behint a kist to lie an' sklent,
Or purse-proud, big wi' cent per cent,
An' muckle wame,
In some bit Brugh to represent
A Baillie's name?

lines.line_text: Or is't the paughty, feudal Thane,
Wi' ruffl'd sark an' glancin cane,
Wha thinks himsel nae sheep-shank bane,
But lordly stalks,
While caps an' bonnets aff are taen,
As by he walks?

stanzas.stanza_text:
Or is't the paughty, feudal Thane,
Wi' ruffl'd sark an' glancin cane,
Wha thinks himsel nae sheep-shank bane,
But lordly stalks,
While caps an' bonnets aff are taen,
As by he walks?

lines.line_text: 'O Thou wha gies us each guid gift!
' Gie me o' wit an' sense a lift,
'Then turn me, if Thou please, adrift,
' Thro' Scotland wide;
'Wi' cits nor lairds I wadna shift,
' In a' their pride! '

stanzas.stanza_text:
'O Thou wha gies us each guid gift!
' Gie me o' wit an' sense a lift,
'Then turn me, if Thou please, adrift,
' Thro' Scotland wide;
'Wi' cits nor lairds I wadna shift,
' In a' their pride! '

lines.line_text: Were this the charter of our state,
'On pain o' hell be rich an' great,'
Damnation then would be our fate,
Beyond remead;
But, thanks to Heav'n, that's no the gate
We learn our creed.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Were this the charter of our state,
'On pain o' hell be rich an' great,'
Damnation then would be our fate,
Beyond remead;
But, thanks to Heav'n, that's no the gate
We learn our creed.

lines.line_text: For thus the royal Mandate ran,
When first the human race began,
'The social, friendly, honest man,
' Whate'er he be,
''Tis he fulfils great Nature's plan,
' And none but he. '

stanzas.stanza_text:
For thus the royal Mandate ran,
When first the human race began,
'The social, friendly, honest man,
' Whate'er he be,
''Tis he fulfils great Nature's plan,
' And none but he. '

lines.line_text: O Mandate, glorious and divine!
The followers o' the ragged Nine,
Poor, thoughtless devils! yet may shine
In glorious light,
While sordid sons o' Mammon's line
Are dark as night!

stanzas.stanza_text:
O Mandate, glorious and divine!
The followers o' the ragged Nine,
Poor, thoughtless devils! yet may shine
In glorious light,
While sordid sons o' Mammon's line
Are dark as night!

lines.line_text: Tho' here they scrape, an' squeeze, an' growl,
Their worthless nievefu' of a soul,
May in some future carcase howl,
The forest's fright;
Or in some day-detesting owl
May shun the light.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Tho' here they scrape, an' squeeze, an' growl,
Their worthless nievefu' of a soul,
May in some future carcase howl,
The forest's fright;
Or in some day-detesting owl
May shun the light.

lines.line_text: Then may L*****K and B**** arise,
To reach their native, kindred skies,
And sing their pleasures, hopes an' joys,
In some mild sphere,
Still closer knit in friendship's ties
Each passing year!

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then may L*****K and B**** arise,
To reach their native, kindred skies,
And sing their pleasures, hopes an' joys,
In some mild sphere,
Still closer knit in friendship's ties
Each passing year!
